content: Bank Account DBS Multiplier Singapore Saving Bonds (SSB) Asked by AnonymousAsked on 03 Sep 2019Is the dividend from SSB only recognised for the first 12 months, for the extra interest rate for DBS Multiplier?Do I have to invest in other things after a year to qualify for the extra interest rate?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Eugene WeeLevel 3. WonderkidUpdated on 03 Sep 2019No, you actually need only to buy for the first 6 months. As the interest from SSB gets distributed every 6 months, from the 7th month onwards, you'll get the interest from the 1st month, 8th for the 2nd month and so on. A bond ladder effectively.This will last 10 years and will fulfil the extra interest for the investment category of DBS multiplier, at least till they change the regulations.3 comments4

See all 3 comments JWjiajing wang03 Sep 2019If u are referring to the multiplier interest rate... Yes, only for the 1st 12 month.. To continue meeting the "investment" criteria, you need to switch funds after 12 monthsPat03 Sep 2019For a more comprehensive understanding, look at C.5 Investments here. https://www.dbs.com.sg/iwov-resources/pdf/deposits/multiplier-programme/DBS%20Multiplier%20Programme_FAQ.pdf
